descriptionHTML:
◇With Material Design, So Smart. - Classnote : Simple Timetable◇
It's recommended to students who want extremely simple school scheduler application. Let's manage your pressing every week with Classnote!

(English is not my native language, so please forgive me for the poor explanation. And I would appreciate it if you could tell my English mistakes in the application or this explanation.)

◆What is Classnote?◆
With the use of Classnote, you can manage a timetable and assignments. This application is made based on Material Design that is a new design language developed by Google. So Classnote combines well-ordered user interface and convenience which other school timetable applications do not have.

◆Enabled devices◆
• Smartphones / Tablets with Android 4.0.3 and newer version.
• Android Wear with Android 5.0 and newer version.

◆Localization◆
• English • Japanese - 日本語

◆About this application's permissions◆
• "full network access" / "view network connections" : For the purpose of showing an advertisement
• "modify or delete the contents of your SD card" / "read the contents of your SD card" : For the purpose of providing functions that your timetable / assignments / subjects data export to, import from external storage.
• "run at startup" : For the purpose of setting assignment's notifications when your device start up.
comments: Definitely the best timetable application out there. This is a really good app, from what I've seen so far. The reason it gets 4 stars is because I think it should have a way of editing the room and teacher for a registered subject on a period-by-period basis. Right now I have to have a separate registered subject for each different room, or I have to have unregistered subjects. Neither option is particularly desirable. Other than that though this app is great and I still highly recommend it.

Very handy with good UI on both Phone and Smartwatch. Would be very nice to have notifications at the start of each period and if the weeks changed automatically.  One issue I have at the moment is that I've set the timetable refresh time to '16:00 the day before', regardless, the timetable won't update until 00:00 on the day.
Its great, does the basic things I expected it to do and has a nice theme/layout. Only thing I'd add is separate times for each day. Other than that, its pretty great for a free app!

Really good for school timetable! The timetable feature is the best one ive found and supports moving devices. however it can be quite tedious to set up and i havnt found a good use for the assignments mainly because i am not allowed to use my phone when they are set.

Like it. Best timetable application till date. Would be great if you could add notifications for lectures and assignments. Also the banner ads are kind of annoying, would have preferred the earlier full screen ad in between.
Doesn't work if not all your periods are the same time every day Mine different between days of the week, so they stop lining up
recentChanges: - Added a banner ad instead of full-screen ads
- Fixed broken layout when using "Straight lesson from before" on Android 7.0
- Improved Android Wear app based on Material Design for Wearables guidelines
- Reduced the size of the application
- Supported URL links in subject memo
- Enhanced the stability of the application
